instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad or keyboard
threads.message:
Hi there,

Could you please help with solving no trackpad or keyboard problem on this motherboard.

Power button works because mac responds to ON/OFF and SMC reset but cant type or use trackpad.

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is present on J4813.

<RESISTOR>R4823</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R4823</RESISTOR> are good 2k. Also these two lines are okay.

Please advice how to proceed.

Thanks,
Max

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad or keyboard
threads.message: Tried known good trackpad flex? 110% most common issue on this model.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad or keyboard
threads.message: Did I test it with a new cable - of course I did! Was it a good one? Hmmm probably not since after testing it with a third cable everything works now. Hahaha joke is on me. Thanks for your help. I go shame in the corner now :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad or keyboard
threads.message: Lmao all good 4924 first thing to always try is the cable.
